title: Jane Bunn brings a sunny smile as she steps out onto the field at the Caulfield Cup
text:
Melbourne's Caulfield Cup is highly rated on the social calendar, and Jane Bunn was not planning on being outdone.

Australia's favourite weather presenter arrived trackside on Saturday, and showed off her trademark smile as she happily obliged for photos.

The 40-year-old dressed for the occasion in a green round-neck frock with pink and purple floral detail, which she teamed with silver strappy heels.

Sunny smiles with a chance of glamour! Australia's favourite weather presenter Jane Bunn (pictured), 40, brought out the florals for Melbourne's Caulfield Cup on Saturday

Jane's shoulder-length blonde tresses were styled in voluminous waves, and she added a pink fascinator.

The Channel Seven star's makeup palette included defined brows, kohl-lined eyes, lashings of mascara and a soft pink lip.

Jane took to Instagram to share details of her race day look, and credited her glam squad.

Details: Jane's shoulder-length blonde tresses were styled in voluminous waves, and she added a pink fascinator

Beauty: The Channel Seven star's makeup palette included defined brows, kohl-lined eyes, lashings of mascara and a soft pink lip

'Caulfield Cup,' the blonde beauty captioned two photos of her race day ensemble, alongside a love heart emoji.

Meanwhile on Tuesday, Jane showed off a rather conservative ensemble while hosting the Purple Ladies Lunch charity event in Melbourne.

Jane opted for a black round-neck top, tucked into a pastel blue pleated skirt, and finished off with pale pink pointy-toe shoes.

Generous Jane! The Channel Seven star lent her profile to a charity event on Tuesday. Jane hosted the Purple Ladies Lunch in Melbourne

The event was designed to raise money to fight bone marrow failure syndromes and Jane was happy to help, praising the event online.

'What an afternoon hosting 180 ladies at the Purple Ladies Lunch, hearing stories from an inspirational lineup of speakers - all to raise funds for #maddiesvision,' she wrote on Instagram.

Maddie's Vision is dedicated to Maddie Riewoldt, who tragically died after living with the autoimmune disease Aplastic Anaemia for five years.
description: Australia's favourite weather presenter Jane Bunn appeared at Caulfield Racecourse ready with her iconic smile dressed in a heavily floral themed dark green dress.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
